text_block_list.text:
With a long day's work behind me, I<n>allow my mind to
wander a bit. As it<n>would turn out, I haven't been able to<n>
forget about Manhattan Cafe.
choice_data_list: I wonder if she's out there again...

text_block_list.text:
I make to leave my room and head<n>for the track, not
knowing who, or<n>what, I will find.
Click, clack.

The door doesn't budge. No matter<n>how much I twist and
turn the knob, it<n>refuses to open.
choice_data_list: (Is someone pushing on the other side?)

text_block_list.text:
Knowing that shouldn't be the case, I<n>tense up my shoulder
and ram the<n>door. It gives way this time, and on<n>the other
side I'm greeted by...
No one.

I convince myself that the door fixture<n>itself is to blame, and
make my way<n>down to the track without much of a<n>
second thought.

text_block_list.name: Manhattan Cafe
text_block_list.text: Pant, pant...

text_block_list.name: Manhattan Cafe
text_block_list.text:
I've been running after you... ever<n>since I was little... Why...
can't I ever<n>catch up?

text_block_list.name: Manhattan Cafe
text_block_list.text: ...How are you able to accelerate<n>through corners like that?

text_block_list.name: Manhattan Cafe
text_block_list.text:
How... do you maintain that form? It's<n>as elegant as willow
branches<n>swaying in the breeze.

text_block_list.name: Manhattan Cafe
text_block_list.text:
...You're just... so incredible. But even<n>so... I'm definitely
going to catch up<n>with you someday...

text_block_list.name: Manhattan Cafe
text_block_list.text:
...So I'm going to keep running. And<n>running... No matter how
long it takes...

Manhattan Cafe's silhouette melts<n>into the shadowy
reaches of the track.<n>She soon re-emerges onto the final<n>
straightaway with an incredible burst<n>of speed.

text_block_list.name: Manhattan Cafe
text_block_list.text: Haaah!

Her jet-black hair does well to keep<n>her concealed in the
murky darkness,<n>but she's able to make her presence<n>
known with an explosion of speed.

What do you think? That ability of<n>hers is quite impressive,
is it not?

text_block_list.name: Agnes Tachyon
text_block_list.text:
Hehe, surprised to see me? I'm sure<n>your blood pressure
spiked a fair bit<n>just now. I'd love to get a pulse<n>reading,
but there are other matters at<n>hand.

text_block_list.name: Agnes Tachyon
text_block_list.text:
I assume that you are one of the new<n>trainers looking for
someone to scout.<n>Or perhaps...

text_block_list.name: Agnes Tachyon
text_block_list.text:
You are a trespassing rascal, spying<n>on Umamusume late at
night. I would<n>be obligated to report you, of course.

text_block_list.name: Agnes Tachyon
text_block_list.text:
Is that so? Well that's good to hear.<n>Caught your attention,
has she?
choice_data_list: I'm a little curious, that's all.

text_block_list.name: Agnes Tachyon
text_block_list.text:
Oh? I wonder what the source of that<n>curiosity could be. Is it
her abilities, or<n>have you noticed some manner of<n>strange
phenomena that seemingly<n>stem from her?

text_block_list.name: Agnes Tachyon
text_block_list.text:
No matter, I suppose. You'd best<n>speak with her directly
rather than<n>gawk from afar. Time is finite, after<n>all.

text_block_list.name: Agnes Tachyon
text_block_list.text:
And while I'd be interested in<n>observing how she chooses
to<n>engage with you, I'm afraid I must<n>get back to my
research.

text_block_list.name: Agnes Tachyon
text_block_list.text: Ah, but allow me to impart one piece<n>of advice.

text_block_list.name: Agnes Tachyon
text_block_list.text:
Be assertive in your proposal. You'll<n>find that she can be
surprisingly<n>compliant.
What was that all about?

"Strange phenomena," though. Has<n>she also experienced
such after<n>interacting with Manhattan Cafe?

text_block_list.name: Manhattan Cafe
text_block_list.text: Pant, pant...

text_block_list.name: Manhattan Cafe
text_block_list.text: Hm? Yes... it is.
choice_data_list: Do you always train this late?

text_block_list.name: Manhattan Cafe
text_block_list.text: ...Yes. I can see her better... at night.

text_block_list.name: Manhattan Cafe
text_block_list.text: ...Do you... have any business with<n>me?
choice_data_list:
It seemed like you were talking with someone
just now.

text_block_list.name: Manhattan Cafe
text_block_list.text: ...Yes.

text_block_list.name: Manhattan Cafe
text_block_list.text: With my friend.
I glance around the empty track,<n>unable to spot anyone else.

text_block_list.name: Manhattan Cafe
text_block_list.text:
You won't be able to see her... No one<n>can, no matter how
hard they look...

text_block_list.name: Manhattan Cafe
text_block_list.text:
So please... don't concern yourself<n>with it. You really...
shouldn't.

text_block_list.name: Manhattan Cafe
text_block_list.text:
I'm the only one... who ever notices<n>her. She... she remains
far away, even<n>from me...
choice_data_list: So you have a friend that only you can see?
So you have a friend that only you can see?

text_block_list.text:
I take her word for it, but what could<n>that possibly mean? A
"friend" that<n>only she can see?
Is she talking about something like a<n>ghost?
InCorRecT

No one is around but the two of us. I<n>can't claim to have
heard a voice, but<n>my mind has somehow been<n>infiltrated
with an answer to my query.

text_block_list.name: Manhattan Cafe
text_block_list.text: Do you find me... "creepy"?

text_block_list.name: Manhattan Cafe
text_block_list.text: Nothing... Forget I asked.

text_block_list.name: Manhattan Cafe
text_block_list.text: ...Excuse me.
Manhattan Cafe gives me a slight<n>bow, and walks off.

I cannot deny that I do seem to be<n>experiencing strange
phenomena.<n>Could it have something to do with<n>this
"friend" of hers?

There's certainly a lot on my mind,<n>but more than anything, I
cannot stop<n>thinking about her amazing running<n>earlier.
